events.message: The insured reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 30th involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident due to reported vehicle damage and collision circumstances.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the claim, tasked with guiding the customer through the process and coordinating inspections.
The claim acknowledgement notice was sent to the customer, confirming the receipt and next steps for their auto accident claim.
The insurer requested all relevant documents including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates.
The customer submitted scanned copies of the police report, collision photos, and the car repair cost estimates as requested.
Claims investigators initiated the review process including verifying facts, inspecting submitted documents, and contacting involved parties.
The investigation was completed successfully, confirming the insured was not at fault and the vehicle damage was consistent with the accident.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair estimates, covering all damages and associated costs as per policy terms.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the transparency throughout the claim process.
The claim was formally approved by the insurance company after review of the settlement agreement signed by the insured.
The approved settlement payment was processed and issued to the insuredâ€™s bank account as per their instructions.
Following successful payment, the insurance claim was officially closed with all documents archived in the system.
The claim record was archived for future reference and audit purposes, ensuring compliance with company policies.
